metadata.title: CVE-2019-9947 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in urllib2 in Python 2.x through 2.7.16 and urllibin Python 3.x through 3.7.3. CRLF injection is possible if the attackercontrols a url parameter, as demonstrated by the first argument tourllib.request.urlopen with \r\n (specifically in the path component of aURL that lacks a ? character) followed by an HTTP header or a Rediscommand. This is similar to the CVE-2019-9740 query string issue. This isfixed in: v2.7.17, v2.7.17rc1, v2.7.18, v2.7.18rc1; v3.5.10, v3.5.10rc1,v3.5.8, v3.5.8rc1, v3.5.8rc2, v3.5.9; v3.6.10, v3.6.10rc1, v3.6.11,v3.6.11rc1, v3.6.12, v3.6.9, v3.6.9rc1; v3.7.4, v3.7.4rc1, v3.7.4rc2,v3.7.5, v3.7.5rc1, v3.7.6, v3.7.6rc1, v3.7.7, v3.7.7rc1, v3.7.8, v3.7.8rc1,v3.7.9.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9947` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm2
libpython2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm2
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm2
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm2
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm2
python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm2
python2.7-examples - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm2
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

idle-python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm2
libpython3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm2
libpython3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm2
libpython3.4-stdlib - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm2
libpython3.4-testsuite - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm2
python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm2
python3.4-examples - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm2
python3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm2
python3.4-venv - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm2').
python3.4 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm2').
python3.5 package in trusty/esm is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2019-04-10').
